info.title: Kitsu API
info.description:
## Welcome to the Kitsu API specification ```Version: 0.20.83``` The Kitsu API allows to store and manage the data of your animation/VFX production. Through it you can link all the tools of your pipeline and make sure they are all synchronized. An easy to use Python client to access this API is available: [Python Kitsu Client documentation](https://gazu.cg-wire.com/) ## Authentication

Before you can use any of the endpoints outlined below, you will need to obtain a JWT token to authorize your requests.

You will find detailed information on how to retrieve authentication tokens in the [Zou documentation](https://zou.cg-wire.com/api/).

All API requests require authentication via JWT tokens passed in the Authorization header.

post.summary: Login user
post.description: Log in user by creating and registering auth tokens. Login is based on email and password. If no user matches given email It fallbacks to a desktop ID. It is useful for desktop tools that don't know user email. It is also possible to login with TOTP, Email OTP, FIDO and recovery code.

totp.description: TOTP verification code for two-factor authentication

email_otp.description: Email OTP verification code for two-factor authentication

get.summary: Logout user
get.description: Log user out by revoking auth tokens. Once logged out, current user cannot access the API anymore.

get.summary: Check authentication status
get.description: Returns information if the user is authenticated. It can be used by third party tools, especially browser frontend, to know if current user is still logged in.

post.summary: Register new user
post.description: Allow a user to register himself to the service.

post.summary: Change user password
post.description: Allow the user to change his password. Requires current password for verification and password confirmation to ensure accuracy.

post.summary: Request password reset
post.description: Send a password reset token by email to the user. It uses a classic scheme where a token is sent by email.

put.summary: Reset password with token
put.description: Allow a user to change his password when he forgets it. It uses a token sent by email to the user to verify it is the user who requested the password reset.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

get.summary: Refresh access token
get.description: Tokens are considered outdated every two weeks. This route allows to extend their lifetime before they get outdated.

post.summary: Enable TOTP
post.description: Enable TOTP (Time-based One-Time Password) authentication. It requires verification code from authenticator app.

totp.description: TOTP verification code from authenticator app

400.description: TOTP already enabled or verification failed

delete.summary: Disable TOTP
delete.description: Disable TOTP (Time-based One-Time Password) authentication. It requires two-factor authentication verification.

400.description: TOTP not enabled or verification failed

put.summary: Pre-enable TOTP
put.description: Prepare TOTP (Time-based One-Time Password) for enabling. It returns provisioning URI and secret for authenticator app setup.

get.summary: Send email OTP
get.description: Send a one-time password by email to the user for authentication.

post.summary: Enable email OTP
post.description: Enable email OTP (One-Time Password) authentication. It requires verification code sent to email.

400.description: Email OTP already enabled or verification failed

delete.summary: Disable email OTP
delete.description: Disable email OTP (One-Time Password) authentication. It requires two-factor authentication verification.

400.description: Email OTP not enabled or verification failed

put.summary: Pre-enable email OTP
put.description: Prepare email OTP (One-Time Password) for enabling. It sets up email-based two-factor authentication.

put.summary: Generate recovery codes
put.description: Generate new recovery codes for two-factor authentication. It requires two-factor authentication verification.

400.description: No two-factor authentication enabled or verification failed

get.summary: Get FIDO challenge
get.description: Get a challenge for FIDO device authentication. It is used for WebAuthn authentication flow.

post.summary: Register FIDO device
post.description: Register a FIDO device for WebAuthn authentication. It requires registration response from the device.

delete.summary: Unregister FIDO device
delete.description: Unregister a FIDO device from WebAuthn authentication. It requires two-factor authentication verification.

device_name.description: Name of the FIDO device to unregister

400.description: FIDO not enabled or verification failed

put.summary: Pre-register FIDO device
put.description: Prepare FIDO device for registration. It returns registration options for WebAuthn.

post.summary: SAML SSO login
post.description: Handle SAML SSO login response. Processes authentication response from SAML identity provider and creates a new user if they don't exist.

302.description: Login successful, redirect to home page

400.description: SAML not enabled or wrong parameter

get.summary: SAML SSO login redirect
get.description: Initiate SAML SSO login by redirecting to SAML identity provider.

400.description: SAML not enabled or wrong parameter

get.summary: Get asset types
get.description: Retrieve all available asset types (entity types that are not shot, sequence, or episode) with filtering support

200.description: List of asset types successfully retrieved

get.summary: Get asset type
get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific asset type including metadata and configuration

parameters.name: asset_type_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the asset type

get.summary: Get all assets
get.description: Retrieve all production assets with filtering and pagination. Supports advanced filtering by project, asset type, task status, and other criteria

get.summary: Get all assets
get.description: Retrieve all production assets with filtering and pagination. Supports advanced filtering by project, asset type, task status, and other criteria

get.summary: Get assets with tasks
get.description: Retrieve all production assets with their related tasks. Includes project name, asset type name, and all associated tasks. Supports filtering by episode

200.description: List of assets with tasks successfully retrieved

parameters.name: episode_id
parameters.description: Filter assets by episode (returns assets not linked to episode and assets linked to given episode)

get.summary: Get asset
get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific asset including metadata, project context, and related data

delete.summary: Delete asset
delete.description: Permanently remove an asset from the system. Only asset creators or project managers can delete assets

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the asset to delete

get.summary: Get linked assets
get.description: Retrieve all assets that are linked to a specific asset through casting relationships

200.description: List of linked assets successfully retrieved

get.summary: Get asset tasks
get.description: Retrieve all tasks related to a specific asset.

200.description: List of asset tasks successfully retrieved

get.summary: Get asset task types
get.description: Retrieve all task types that are used for tasks related to a specific asset.

200.description: List of asset task types successfully retrieved

for_entity.description: Entity type this task type is for

get.summary: Get shots casting asset
get.description: Retrieve all shots that cast a specific asset in their breakdown.

200.description: List of shots casting the asset successfully retrieved

get.summary: Get asset casting
get.description: Retrieve the casting information for a specific asset showing which shots or sequences use this asset

put.summary: Update asset casting
put.description: Modify the casting relationships for a specific asset by updating which shots or sequences use this asset.

get.summary: Get shot asset instances
get.description: Retrieve all shot asset instances that are linked to a specific asset.

200.description: List of shot asset instances successfully retrieved.

get.summary: Get scene asset instances
get.description: Retrieve all scene asset instances that are linked to a specific asset.

200.description: List of scene asset instances successfully retrieved.

get.summary: Get asset instances
get.description: Retrieve all asset instances that are instantiated inside a specific asset.

200.description: List of asset instances successfully retrieved

post.summary: Create asset instance
post.description: Create a new asset instance inside a specific asset by instantiating another asset.

asset_to_instantiate_id.description: Unique identifier of the asset to instantiate

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the parent asset

get.summary: Get project asset type assets
get.description: Retrieve all assets of a specific type within a project.

200.description: List of project asset type assets successfully retrieved

parameters.name: asset_type_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the asset type

post.summary: Create asset
post.description: Create a new asset in a specific project with the given asset type and parameters.

is_shared.description: Whether the asset is shared across projects

parameters.name: asset_type_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the asset type

get.summary: Get project asset types
get.description: Retrieve all asset types available for a specific project

200.description: List of project asset types successfully retrieved

get.summary: Get shot asset types
get.description: Retrieve all asset types of assets that are casted in a specific shot

200.description: List of shot asset types successfully retrieved

get.summary: Get project assets
get.description: Retrieve all assets belonging to a specific project with filtering support

200.description: List of project assets successfully retrieved

post.summary: Set assets shared
post.description: Share or unshare a specific list of assets by their IDs.

asset_ids.description: List of asset IDs to update

is_shared.description: Whether to share or unshare the assets

post.summary: Set project assets shared
post.description: Share or unshare all assets for a specific project or a list of specific assets.

is_shared.description: Whether to share or unshare the assets

post.summary: Set asset type assets shared
post.description: Share or unshare all assets for a specific project and asset type.

is_shared.description: Whether to share or unshare the assets

200.description: Asset type assets shared status successfully updated

parameters.name: asset_type_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the asset type

get.summary: Get shared assets used in project
get.description: Retrieve all shared assets that are used in a specific project.

200.description: List of shared assets used in project successfully retrieved

get.summary: Get shared assets used in episode
get.description: Retrieve all shared assets that are used in a specific project episode.

200.description: List of shared assets used in episode successfully retrieved

get.summary: Get entity casting
get.description: Retrieve the casting information for a specific entity showing which assets are linked to it.

put.summary: Update entity casting
put.description: Modify the casting relationships for a specific entity by updating which assets are linked to it.

get.summary: Get asset type casting
get.description: Retrieve the casting information for all assets of a specific asset type in a project.

200.description: Asset type casting information successfully retrieved

parameters.name: asset_type_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the asset type

get.summary: Get episodes casting
get.description: Retrieve the casting information for all episodes in a specific project.

get.summary: Get sequence shots casting
get.description: Retrieve the casting information for all shots from a specific sequence.

200.description: Sequence shots casting information successfully retrieved

get.summary: Get episode shots casting
get.description: Retrieve the casting information for all shots from a specific episode.

200.description: Episode shots casting information successfully retrieved

get.summary: Get project shots casting
get.description: Retrieve the casting information for all shots from all sequences in a specific project.

200.description: Project shots casting information successfully retrieved

get.summary: Get project entity links
get.description: Retrieve all entity links related to a specific project. Results can be paginated using page and limit query parameters. If you prefer a more accurate pagination, you can use cursor_created_at to get the next page. It's mainly used for synchronisation purpose.

parameters.name: cursor_created_at
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination based on creation date

delete.summary: Delete entity link
delete.description: Delete a specific entity link. It's mainly used for synchronisation purpose.

parameters.name: entity_link_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the entity link

get.summary: Get scene asset instances
get.description: Retrieve all asset instances that are linked to a specific scene.

post.summary: Create scene asset instance
post.description: Create an asset instance on a specific scene.

asset_id.description: Asset identifier to create instance from

201.description: Asset instance successfully created on scene

get.summary: Get scene camera instances
get.description: Retrieve all camera instances that are linked to a specific scene.

get.summary: Get shot asset instances
get.description: Retrieve all asset instances that are linked to a specific shot.

post.summary: Add shot asset instance
post.description: Add an asset instance to a specific shot.

201.description: Asset instance successfully added to shot

delete.summary: Remove shot asset instance
delete.description: Remove an asset instance from a specific shot.

204.description: Asset instance successfully removed from shot

parameters.name: asset_instance_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the asset instance

get.summary: Get chat details
get.description: Retrieve chat information and messages for a specific entity. Returns chat metadata including participants and all associated messages.

entity_id.description: Entity ID this chat is associated with

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: ID of the entity related to the chat

get.summary: Get chat messages
get.description: Retrieve all chat messages for a specific entity. Returns a list of messages with sender information and timestamps.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: ID of the entity related to the chat

post.summary: Create chat message
post.description: Create a new chat message for a specific entity. Supports both JSON and form data with optional file attachments. Only chat participants can send messages.

files.description: Files to attach to the message

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: ID of the entity related to the chat

get.summary: Get chat message
get.description: Retrieve a specific chat message by its ID. Returns detailed message information including content and metadata.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: ID of the entity related to the chat

delete.summary: Delete chat message
delete.description: Delete a specific chat message. Only the message author or administrators can delete messages.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: ID of the entity related to the chat

parameters.name: chat_message_id
parameters.description: ID of the chat message to delete

post.summary: Acknowledge comment
post.description: Acknowledge a specific comment. If it's already acknowledged, remove the acknowledgement.

post.summary: Reply to comment
post.description: Add a reply to a specific comment. The reply will be added to the comment's replies list.

person_id.description: Person identifier who made the reply

delete.summary: Delete comment attachment
delete.description: Delete a specific attachment file linked to a comment. Only the comment author or project managers can delete attachments.

delete.summary: Delete comment reply
delete.description: Delete a specific reply from a comment. Only the reply author or administrators can delete replies.

get.summary: Download attachment file
get.description: Download a specific attachment file from a comment or chat message. Supports various file types including images and documents.

parameters.name: attachment_file_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the attachment file

parameters.name: file_name
parameters.description: Name of the file to download

post.summary: Add comment attachments
post.description: Add one or more files as attachments to a specific comment. Supports various file types including images and documents.

parameters.name: files
parameters.description: Files to attach to the comment

get.summary: Get project attachment files
get.description: Retrieve all attachment files related to a specific project. Requires administrator permissions.

get.summary: Get task attachment files
get.description: Retrieve all attachment files related to a specific task. Requires administrator permissions.

post.summary: Create task comment
post.description: Create a new comment for a specific task. It requires a text, a task_status and a person as arguments. This way, comments keep history of status changes. When the comment is created, it updates the task status with the given task status.

comment.example: This looks great! Ready for review.

person_id.description: Person identifier (optional, defaults to current user)

created_at.description: Creation timestamp (optional, defaults to current time)

comment.example: This looks great! Ready for review.

post.summary: Create multiple comments
post.description: Create several comments at once for a specific project. Each comment requires a text, a task id, a task_status and a person as arguments. This way, comments keep history of status changes. When the comment is created, it updates the task status with the given task status.

comment.example: This looks great! Ready for review.

person_id.description: Person identifier (optional, defaults to current user)

created_at.description: Creation timestamp (optional, defaults to current time)

comment.example: This looks great! Ready for review.
